entry.title: 90Droid v7.9 Released
entry.content:
This is a HUGE release for 90Droid

YouTube videos of your workouts:

Now you can link your exercises to videos in YouTube!

If you see the YouTube icon above, simply tap on it and you will watch it right there:

Credit to Laura London

YouTube video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HK6mKUEY09o

Her Page: http://www.lauralondonfitness.com

New cleaner more modern interface:

If you have android 3.0 or Higher, you'll see the new cleaner interface

Import from 90Droid Free button:

If you have the free version and want to upgrade, simply have them both installed and go to the premium version > Backup/Restore and hit the "Import from 90Droidfree". That's it, when you see the success message you are ready to use the premium version.

New Exercise Type: Timer

This is a count timer, when you star it you'll hear a beep

Shows in yellow and beeps a warning sound when you get to 10 seconds

You'll get a different beep when you are done

 

As an Example we have shared the Laura London Standing up Abs one week program that uses this timers

Quick sorting of Days:

It is now very easy to change the order of your days, simply drag and drop in the new interface:

Go to the Programs Editor and select "Quick Sort" from the menu

Then just drag an drop the list from the handle. Once you are done hit Save.

entry.title: 90Droid v7.2 Released
entry.content:
The most requested feature by power users:  Sorting of the days in a program definition. Here is how:

Go to Programs

Tap on the menu icon right the  (editable) Program. If not editable, hit menu and clone, that will give you a new program that you can modify

Once on the Edit screen tap the menu button at the bottom left of the screen and select More

Then select Quick-sort days:

Once there sort the days by pulling the days up or down by the handles on the left side:

Once you are happy with the results, hit save:

And the changes are displayed as you are taken back to the edit screen

Please keep in mind that this is still under construction but it is working very well so far. Please let us know of any comments you might have .

Happy new year's everybody

Team 90Droid

entry.title: Get the new “90Droid Free”
entry.content:
"90Droid Free" is the new version of the app. Designed for people that want to give 90Droid a try. It offers the Three most used workout programs for you to track.

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.unifylog.droid90free

Marry Christmas everybody!

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v7.0 Released
entry.content:
The program lists now display the average ratings for the shared program:

Enjoy,

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v6.3 Released
entry.content:
We have made it easier to create custom exercise programs. By adding the menu button to every "day" entry. See the pictures below:

This is in response to  Fit Scholar's review: http://fitscholar.com/software/90droid-p90x-app

entry.title: 90Droid v6.2 Released
entry.content:
Do you want to type your weights and repetitions?
This is your chance,

Just go to Weights and select "Type Weights and Reps."

Enjoy

entry.title: 90Droid v5.0 Released
entry.content:
Added nutrition section where you can keep track of your calorie count. You can also enter data for previous dates.

Enjoy

entry.title: 90Droid v4.6 Released
entry.content:
This version offers a way to enter previous workouts, a frequently requested feature.

To do that simply tap on menu > Show Workout Date, this will set the date for the workout, this date will be persistent so you can enter as many as you need for the same day.

If the workout date is not shown, today's date will be used as usual.

Enjoy,

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v4.2 Released
entry.content:
To all 90Droiders. We have released this new version, we are sure you'll love it.

* Added the ability to create your own dumbbell sets/band sets
* Now you can switch between bands and dumbbells
* Now you can create your own custom exercises.

* Added the ability to create your own dumbbell sets/band sets* Now you can switch between bands and dumbbells * Now you can create your own custom exercises.

Enjoy

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v3.6.0 released
entry.content:
We are titling this release:  Thou shalt not scroll!!
90Droid will remember your last position on the program and highlight the latest workout you completed.

Enjoy,
Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v3.5.0 released
entry.content:
Did somebody say Insanity? No need to pay extra, it's all here and yes, it's free for all of you 90Droid lovers.

Enjoy

entry.title: 90Droid v3.2.0 released
entry.content:
Hello 90Droid fans, this is a huge release for us. We have included P90X Plus to the app.

So all you need to do is update and you'll get them for FREE.

So if you are ready for the next level, all you need to do is select the The plus workouts, that is three new Programs: Plus Classic, Plus Lean and Plus Doubles. and new Workout Groups: Upper, Total Body, Abs Core, Interval. And since it's part of the app, you get charts, backup and all the features that make 90Droid unique.

To celebrate this launch we have reduced the price of the app for a limited time, so go ahead and take advantage of this opportunity.

Enjoy
Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v3.1.0 released
entry.content:
We have included the following fixes:

* Maintaining position on day and workout lists.

* Marking individual workouts as completed with a checkmark.
* Fixed backup issue for myTouch 4G and other

entry.title: 90Droid v3.0.1 Released
entry.content:
We have immediately released an update to fix the reported problem about the license not being recognized. Sorry for the inconvenience, it is safe to download the new version 3.0.1

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v3.0.0 Released
entry.content:
This release implements the Android Market Licensing allowing users with rooted devices to see and install the app.

Enjoy,

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v2.9 Released
entry.content:
This is a maintenance release that includes:

- Fixes for HoneyComb tablets.  –Thanks Robert

- Added Another B-lines band set from BeachBody.  – Thanks Dave

entry.title: 90Droid v2.8 Released
entry.content: We have created the cycles functionality. This will let you "start over" whenever you want. This has been a very frequent request from the our 90Droid fans.

entry.title: 90Droid v2.7 Released
entry.content:
Hello everybody, we have released version 2.7 of 90Droid.

The new feature lets you chart your measurements progress. That is: Weight, Body fat %, Chest, Hips, Arms, Neck, Waist and Thighs.

Enjoy.

entry.title: 90Droid v2.6.5 Released
entry.content:
On this version:

* Minor fixes to the backup functionality (User Interface)
* Added Zero weight option. (Thank you Donna)
* Included waist measurement column when on landscape mode. (Thank you JD)

entry.title: 90Droid v2.6.2 Released
entry.content:
On this release we address a common concern amongst users:  Backup/Restore. Here is how it works:

In the main screen press the "menu" key and select "Backup/Restore".

Back up

Click on the "Backup" button and the process starts:

You need to select a google account from the list (to be used to log you in)

Both your Workouts and Measurements are uploaded to a secure google server. Note: this will overwrite the previous backup.

Restore

Click on the "Restore" button and the process starts:

You need to select a google account from the list (to be used to log you in)

You will be presented with a list of devices that have had back ups using the same google account. (Useful to back up in one device and restore in another) Select one of them.

Both your Workouts and Measurements are downloaded from the cloud. Note: this will overwrite your local data.

entry.title: 90Droid v2.5 Released
entry.content: In this release we implemented the ability to change the date of previous measurements. This is done in a similar fashion to the change date for previous workouts: press the measurement element in the list. Then select "Edit Date". Thank you Daniel S.

entry.title: 90Droid v2.3.5 Released
entry.content:
This was an emergency fix. It looks like some people were having issues with the 2.3 release that forced close when selecting a workout. We are terribly sorry about the incident. It you have any comments please send us a note.

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v2.3 Released
entry.content:
In this release we have included better landscape layout:

We have also fixed charts not showing data in droid 2 and My Touch 4G

entry.title: 90Droid v2.2 Released
entry.content:
The most requested feature in the history of 90Droid. In this release we have a gift for all you 90Droid fans: Charts!!. Happy Holidays!!

Note: available for devices running Android 2.1 and up

entry.title: 90Droid v2.1 Released
entry.content:
There are 3 frequently requested changes in this version:
* Ability to select date for a saved workout
* Customization of the number of reps.
* Added extra values for weights (8 & 12). This is a temporary solution, we are implementing the customization of the weights.

entry.title: 90Droid v2.0 Released
entry.content: This release include the ability to track each ab ripper exercise separately. It also separates the workout list by workout groups.

entry.title: 90Droid v1.9.5 Released
entry.content:
This is a maintenance release to fix some reported bugs:

* Fixes the reported  glitch with "Notes" on Droid X (Thanks Kelly)
* Fixes an scheduling error in Weeks 10 and 11 in the classic program (Thanks Jeff)

entry.title: 90Droid v1.9 Released
entry.content: Added Bowflex®  Selecttech 1090 and extended standard dumbbells

entry.title: 90Droid v1.8 Released
entry.content: In this release we are including the visual indicators of completed exercises. When you workout on a specific day, the check mark will appear next to the last date it was done.  In case the same day has been done more than once, the number of times will appear in parenthesis.

entry.title: 90Droid v1.7 Released
entry.content:
Double fun in this release. We added support for doubles so now you can track your cardio in the A.M. and the resistance in the P.M.

Also in this release, the visual separation by week in the main screen makes it easier to navigate.

Enjoy,

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v1.6 Released
entry.content:
This release includes the long-requested custom notes. Now you can type your comments on every exercise. Here is how it works:

When you click on the notes button you get this screen where you can type any comment you want

You can also  select any of the quick notes on the list. This will replace whatever was in the text field

Once the notes are saved, they will be displayed in a short format in the previous list. Ellipsis denote text too long to display in that space. Also note that the Date is now displayed in a new column

To read the full-length text:

Long-press over the element in the previous list and select"View Notes"

That will display the notes for that workout instance

entry.title: 90Droid v1.5 Released
entry.content:
One of the most requested features, the ability to select between Lean and Classic.

Note: The programs are independent from each other. So your history in Lean is independent of the one in Classic

entry.title: 90Droid v1.4 Released
entry.content:
One of the most anticipated releases is finally out. It features  multiple measurements tracking.

If you are doing p90x you want to keep track of your weight and body fat percentage. You also want to see your results by comparing your measurements with certain frequency and add notes to help you with your progress.

To reach the measurements list screen press menu and select measurements.

Enjoy

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v1.3 Released
entry.content:
Don't you hate it when your phone locks in the middle of your workout? Well we have the solution in this release.

*This feature is only available for Android 2.1 and higher.

entry.title: 90Droid v1.2 Released
entry.content:
In this release we have includes:

* The ability to edit/delete previous items.

Long press an item in the list to bring up the menu.

- Delete will remove the record permanently

- Copy to Current will copy the selected Weight/Reps/Notes to the top controls.

* Some minor improvements in the user interface.

Enjoy,

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v1.1 Released
entry.content:
This release includes a minor fix for the shoulders and arms routine.

It also lets you open the menu from the workout group list

entry.title: 90Droid v1.0 Released
entry.content:
We have released the first version of 90Droid, a fitness tracker for P90X.

As P90X grads and after trying several apps, we realized that there was a need for a fitness trackers created specifically for p90X. These are the design guidelines:

  • You must be able to log a workout with minimum effort. Let's face it, in the middle of your workout you don't want to waste time typing.
  • You should be able to be up and running the minute you download the app.  The app should come pre-configured with the most common options.
  • You should love it. It should make you want to workout and complete the program.

Enjoy

Team 90Droid
